text: 4. Consider a particle whose position at time ¢ > 0 is given by ¥'(t) = (t?,2t,logt). Here we use log for the inverse of the exponential function: log e! = t. (a) Compute the velocity and acceleration. (b) Find the curvature (t) of the trajectory at the point ¥ (t). (c) Find the tangential and the normal component of the acceleration.
